text.section: A debtor, any secondary obligor, or any other secured party or lienholder may redeem collateral.

To redeem collateral, a person shall tender:
Fulfillment of all obligations secured by the collateral; and
The reasonable expenses and attorneyâ€™s fees described in KRS 355.9-615(1)(a).

A redemption may occur at any time before a secured party:
Has collected collateral under KRS 355.9-607;
Has disposed of collateral or entered into a contract for its disposition under KRS 355.9-610; or
Has accepted collateral in full or partial satisfaction of the obligation it secures under KRS 355.9-622.

law.history: Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 408, sec. 141, effective July 1, 2001.
